abstract: British officials announce that report on country's role in Iraq war will be released in summer 2016 after more than six years and costs upward of $15 million; critics question if such reports are even helpful after so much time has passed.
lead_paragraph: The document, slated to be vetted by national security agencies before publication, will come after an inquiry that began in 2009 and has cost more than $15 million.

headline.main: Delayed Report on Britain’s Role in Iraq War Is Expected in Summer
headline.print_headline: Report on British Role in Iraq War Expected in Summer

snippet: The document, slated to be vetted by national security agencies before publication, will come after an inquiry that began in 2009 and has cost more than $15 million.
